bug.author: silas2471
bug.description:
Bokeh Charts are not displayed, not even the simple Example from the Documentation. The Bokeh Chart Object is working, as can be seen using bokeh.plotting.show(). Running on a Linux Ubuntu System. What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: Load the Example from <denchmark-link:https://docs.streamlit.io/api.html#display-charts>https://docs.streamlit.io/api.html#display-charts</denchmark-link> . Ony my System an empty website is opened and nothing else happens <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.56.0 Python version: 3.6.9 Using PipEnv OS version: Linux Ubuntu Browser version: Mozilla Firefox 74.0 (Linux) Microsoft Edge 44.18362.449.0 (Windows) Mozilla Firefox 60.7.2esr (Windows)

comments.comment: Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/silas2471>@silas2471</denchmark-link> ! Are you by any chance using Bokeh 2.0 ? Right now Bokeh 2.0 does not work with the current latest version of Streamit, but we just merged a <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/1216>PR</denchmark-link> to fix that, so expect that to be in the next version of Streamlit :) In the meantime you can try to downgrade Bokeh to 1.4.0.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/andfanilo>@andfanilo</denchmark-link> , Yes I am running Bokeh 2.0, thanks for the tip :)

I am using 1.4.0, just upgraded as per suggested from 1.0.4 and streamlit isn't showing my bokeh chart. Tried doing the example and nothing shows up. Python 3.6.5 |Anaconda, Inc.| (default, Apr 29 2018, 16:14:56) [GCC 7.2.0] on linux streamlit version: 0.57.2
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Fred-Macdo>@Fred-Macdo</denchmark-link> , with Streamlit version 0.57 you'll need to use bokeh 2
